intro: Dalea ehrenbergii, commonly known as the Ehrenberg's milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Dalea ehrenbergii plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local pollinators in its native habitat.
